name: Panama
partner: Andrés Bello Foundation – Latin American Chinese Research Center
takeaway: The results portray that the PRC exerts significant levels of influence in the media, academia, the economy, technology and society of Panama.

As home of the largest Chinese diaspora in Central America, the PRC's influence in society and academia amplify the prospects of further exerting influence in areas such as foreign policy, military, domestic politics and law enforcement of Panama, while traditionally the country holds diverging views to China's.
The PRC holds significant investments in Panama Canal-linked supply chains, the mining sector and large infrastructure projects in Panama.
description-1: In 2023, Panama had a GDP per capita of US$18,612 and a total population of 4.47 million people.
description-2: Panama established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 2017. Panama was ranked 83rd in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 83/100.

Media.evidence: CGTN / CGTN Español are broadcasted in Cable TV. Also, Xinhua and Xinhua Español are key sources for El Siglo y La Estrella de Panamá. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Significant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: El Expreso (affiliated to La Estrella de Panamá), Diario Chino, Radio Chinavision and others are owned by chinese diaspora and publish CCP sponsored content. China 507 outlet went as far as endorsing a presidential candidate. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Significant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Both, El Expreso and Diario China have content sharing agreements with PRC state-funded media. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Significant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: The PRC Embassy has paid supplements within local newspapers. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Significant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: According to Freedom House's Beijing Global Media Influence, the main way in which the PRC exerts pressure over journalist is by threatening to pull advertising (mostly from Huawei and Cobre Panama). Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Tes, the Colón Safe City Project focused on Colón City, was organized through an agreement signed between Panama & China , which also includes Huawei. There are regular high level meetings and agreement signing between CCP and Panama City Mayor. Another example is the design and implementation of a digital free trade zone in San Miguelito City promoted by Huawei and financed by Bank of China.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few" and an "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Yes, there are several, including Santiago de Veraguas with Fuzhou and Baoding, Panama City with Shanghai and Guangdong, and Boquete with Gaobeidian.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few" and an "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Yes, Panameñista Party and PRD have taken trips to the PRC, most likely paid by the PRC connected individuals or entities.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" and an "Significant" rating.

Domestic Politics.evidence: All political parties participated in a recent CPC Dialogue with World Political Parties.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" and an "Significant" rating.

Domestic Politics.evidence: While Panama's electoral legislation prohibits foreign donations to political campaigns, local chinese affiliated companies have made contribiutions to political campaigns. Also, there are several reports that former Presdient Varela channeled bribes and campaign contribiutions of Odebrecht through China and chinese companies.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few" and an "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: According to the IRI there are more than 50 organizations and diaspora community groups in Panama with links to the United Front Work. Panama host the largest diaspora community in Central America, which are involved in fundraising, politics and support for government officials and candidates.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few" and an "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Yes, former foreign minister Mouynes praised China's foreign policy, particularly its approach towards multipolarity and equidistance in a new world order. Presidential candidate Maribel Gordón mentioned China as a model for Panama on Human Rights. Several officials and politicians have praised PRC government on political and economic achievements, there have also been other statements, mostly around economic and infrastructure projects such as the BRI.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few" and an "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: After leaving office, former Director General of Foreign Policy, Nicole Wong, who was instrumental in the establishment of diplomatic ties, opened a consulting (lobbying) firm for Chinese interest in Panama.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" and an "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: The Panama-China Council for the Promotion of Peaceful Reunification (PCCPPR) is the Panama chapter of the China Council for the Promotion of Peaceful Reunification, a group that lobbies globally for support of the PRC’s “reunification” with Taiwan under the UFWD. It is at the nexus of United Front activity in Panama.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few" and an "Significant" rating.

Society.evidence: While United Front work emphasizes loyalty to the party and sympathy for Beijing’s interests, United Front groups also genuinely encourage participation in local government to strengthen the voice of the diaspora community and feed those interests into democratic processes. Society.evidence: All-China Women Federation visited Panama and met with different professional associations and several political parties officals. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" and an "Significant" rating.
